BiblioData.Title: LUMINESCENT PARTICLE AND METHOD OF DETECTING A BIOLOGICAL ENTITY USING A LUMINESCENT PARTICLE
BiblioData.Abstract: The invention provides a luminescent particle and a method of detecting a biological entity using a luminescent particle, the luminescent particle comprising a core area and a shell area, the core area being covered by the shell area, the core area conferring a luminescent behavior on the luminescent particle for at least one excitation wavelength and for at least one emission wavelength by means of a nanocrystal material, and the shell area being provided such that it realizes an antireflective coating of the core area.

Claims.P: CLAIMS:

1. Luminescent particle (10) comprising a core area (20) and a shell area (30), the core area (20) being covered by the shell area (30), the core area (20) conferring a luminescent behavior on the luminescent particle (10) for at least one excitation wavelength (40) and for at least one emission wavelength (50) by means of a nanocrystal material (21), and the shell area (30) being provided such that it realizes an antireflective coating (31) of the core area (20).
2. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1, wherein the core area (20) is provided as a quantum dot structure realized by means of a non-Cd-based nanocrystal material (21).
3. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1 , wherein the core area (20) is provided as a quantum dot structure realizsed by means of a non-toxic nanocrystal material (21).
4. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1, 2 or 3, wherein the shell area (30) is provided as a non-Cd-based material and/or a non-toxic material.
5. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1, wherein the core area (20) is provided as a quantum dot structure realized by means of an InP-based-material.

6. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1, wherein the excitation wavelength (40) and the emission wavelength (50) are provided in the near infrared portion (51) of the electromagnetic spectrum.

7. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 6, wherein the excitation wavelength (40) and the emission wavelength (50) are provided in a spectral window of minimal infra red absorption in main components of human tissue, especially in human tissue liquid and/or lipid.
8. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 7, wherein the excitation wavelength (40) and the emission wavelength (50) are provided between 700 nm and 800 nm.
9. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 6 or 7, wherein the excitation wavelength (40) is provided around 720 nm and/or the emission wavelength (50) is provided around 780 nm.
10. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 6 or 7, wherein the excitation wavelength (40) and the emission wavelength (50) are separated by approximately 60 nm.
11. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1 , wherein the thickness (D) of the shell area (30) is provided substantially homogeneously around the core area (20).

12. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 11 , wherein the thickness (D) of the shell area (30) is provided such that the reflectance of excitation radiation (41) and/or the reflectance of emission radiation (51) between the inside of the core area (20) and the outside of the luminescent particle (10) is comparatively low.

13. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1 , wherein the thickness (D) of the shell area (30) is at least partially provided such that the reflectance of excitation radiation (41) and/or the reflectance of emission radiation (51) between the inside of the core area (20) and the outside of the luminescent particle (10) is comparatively low.

14. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 12 or 13, wherein the thickness (D) of the shell area (30) is provided such that the transmittance of excitation radiation (41) and/or the transmittance of emission radiation (51) between the inside of the core area (20) and the outside of the luminescent particle (10) is higher than 50% below, preferably higher than 25% below, most preferably higher than 10% below the maximum transmittance for a given first index of refraction (ni) of the nanocrystal material (21), a given second index of refraction (n2) of the antireflective coating (31), and a given third index of refraction (n3) of the environment of the luminescent particle (10).
15. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1, wherein the shell area (30) comprises a dielectric material (31).
16. Luminescent particle (10) according to claim 15, wherein the dielectric material (31) is provided as TiO2 and/or GaP and/or InGaP2 and/or other ternary compound(s).
17. Complex comprising a luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1 and further comprising a labeling substrate (110).
18. Contrast agent comprising a luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1 or a complex according to claim 17 or a mixture thereof.

19. Method of detecting a biological entity (120) using a luminescent particle (10) comprising a core area (20) and a shell area (30), the core area (20) being covered by the shell area (30), the core area (20) conferring a luminescent behavior on the luminescent particle (10) for at least one excitation wavelength (40) and for at least one emission wavelength (50) by means of a nanocrystal material (21), and the shell area (30) being provided such that it realizes an antireflective coating (31) of the core area (20), the method comprising the steps of:
- forming a complex between the luminescent particle (10) and a labeling substrate (110) by means of a physical and/or a chemical and/or a biological binding (111),

- using the labeling substrate (110) for achieving a specific binding (121) to the biological entity (120), - irradiating at least the complex of the luminescent particle (10) and the labeling substrate (110) with radiation of the excitation wavelength (40), and
- detecting the biological entity (120) by means of radiation emitted by the luminescent particle (10).
20. Method according to claim 19, wherein the complex of the luminescent particle (10) and a labeling substrate (110) is used in vivo.
21. Method according to claim 19, wherein the complex of the luminescent particle (10) and the labeling substrate (110) is used in vitro.
22. Use of the luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1 in a biomedical assay and/or an in vitro application.

23. Use of a luminescent particle (10) according to claim 1 for producing a complex according to claim 17 or a contrast agent according to claim 18 for use in a biomedical assay and/or an in vitro assay.
